edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.filter
Class WatershedFilter

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.filter.Filter
      edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.filter.WatershedFilter
Direct Known Subclasses:
SeededWatershedFilter
public class WatershedFilter
extends Filter

A Filter that segments an Image according to the standard Watershed method. The Image is first inverted, so that the algorithm will find regions starting from high-intensity areas (which is generally more applicable for Image segmentation).

Unlike some implementations, this does not find the gradient of the supplied Image, so if segmentation of the gradient is desired it must be prefiltered.

This Filter does not use a reference Image.

The argument to the apply method should be the Image to be segmented by the watershed algorithm.

Author:
Colin J. Fuller

apply

getSeedImage

protected Image getSeedImage(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Double,java.util.Vector<org.apache.commons.math.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D>> greylevelLookup,
                             Image im,
                             Histogram h)
Gets the seed Image for the watershed segmentation. If no seed Image has been set externally, one is created from the set of pixels at the lowest greylevel. If a seed Image has been set externally, the seedImage retrieved is the union of the external Image and the default one.

Parameters:
greylevelLookup - A hashtable mapping greylevel values in the Image to coordinates in the Image.
im - The Image being segmented.
h - A Histogram of the Image being segmented, constructed before the beginning of segmentation.
Returns:
An Image containing the seeds for the watershed algorithm.

getCorrectLabel

protected int getCorrectLabel(ImageCoordinate ic,
                              Image processing,
                              int nextLabel)
Gets the correct labeling in the segmentation for a pixel at a given coordinate, given a segmentation in progress. This will label a pixel as 0 (a barrier) if it would connect two existing regions, label it as an existing region if it is connected only to that region, or as nextLabel if it is not connected to any existing region.

Parameters:
ic - The ImageCoordinate that is the location to be labeled.
processing - The partial segmentation of the Image.
nextLabel - The next available label for new regions.
Returns:
The appropriate value for the ImageCoordinate: one of 0, an existing region number, or nextLabel.
